text: Molsheim is a commune in north-eastern France, in the Bas-Rhin department, of which it is a subprefecture. It is in the Grand Est region. The commmune is in the historical and cultural region of Alsace. ==Geography== Molsheim is in the central part of the Bas-Rhin department, to the west of Strasbourg. The Bruche river, a left tributary of the Ill river, flows through the commune. The commune has an area of . Its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . The distances from Molsheim to other cities are: * Paris, the national capital - ; * Strasbourg, the regional capital - ; * Marseille - ; * Lyon - ; * Reims - ; * Bordeaux - ; * Toulouse - ; * Montpellier - ; * Nice - . Molsheim and its neighboring communes The commune of Molsheim is surrounded by the following communes: ===Climate=== The climate of Molsheim, in the Köppen climate classification, is Cfb - Oceanic climate with template summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Molsheim are known, in French, as Molsheimois or Molshémiens (women: Molsheimoises). With a population of 9,263, Molsheim has a population density of inhabitants/km2. It is the capital of the Molsheim arrondissement and is also the administrative centre () of the canton of Molsheim formed by 31 communes, with 54,596 inhabitants (2014). === Twin towns === Molsheim is twinned with Gerbrunn (Germany). ==Gallery== File:Molsheim - Hôtel de ville -1.JPG|Town hall of Molsheim.
